column4: siphor - I also have a 120 gb and 200 gb PATA ide drive in that system.  I'd like to keep one of them free fro a possble windoze dual boot down the road.  will I find my system slow if I only use one drive for the root. boot and swap volumes?
since I was on 32 bit windoze before, I expect that 64 bit ubuntu should be fast even if it's on a 7200 rpm PATA drive..

alright, lets see iof I can get this monster going.  It's on my gaming rig conencted to the samsung HDTV in the living room, so I'll be poppong back in to the bedroom computer to check here every so often.  thanks for your help guys
